programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: After a teenage girl makes a rape accusation against a person with a criminal record, but little evidence is found, the girl's father takes matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a female video game developer who has been receiving death threats refuses to delay the launch of her new game, the cops must work to protect her.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: While working under cover to bust a sex trafficking ring, Carisi meets a woman who embedded herself in the organization in hope of finding and saving her daughter; Sgt. Benson is faced with a life-changing revelation.

programme.desc: Sue goes undercover with Tony, a visiting FBI agent, in order to infiltrate a mafia family.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the team are 'shadowed' by an actor as he prepares for his next movie role, an FBI agent.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the team track a missing 727 airplane and three missing gasoline tankers in a race against the clock to stop an impending terrorist strike.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: When Sue and the FBI team track a serial murderer whose victims are powerful and successful women, Sue finds herself matching wits with the killer in a twisted game of 'Simon Says.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue is thrilled to reconnect with a Deaf woman who is an up and coming sculptor. But when the woman becomes a murder suspect, Sue must determine 'did she or didn't she' commit the crime.

programme.desc: Brennan asks Booth to be the father of her child; Stewie Griffin (Seth MacFarlane) offers the couple advice.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A murder forces Ducky to disclose his participation in a secret society devoted to solving cold cases.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Insurgents in Sudan attack volunteer doctors -- including the man married to DiNozzo's ex-girlfriend, Jeanne Benoit.

programme.desc: A petty officer hoping to prove his innocence volunteers to be court martialed by NCIS if the team investigates his case; Jake and Bishop talk about their marital issues.

programme.desc: Abby's brother becomes the prime suspect when the passengers and crew of a private plane traveling from New Orleans are poisoned.

programme.desc: Secretary of the Navy Sarah Porter's daughter is kidnapped; NCIS Special Agent Valerie Page, McGee's childhood friend, assists the team with advance tactics training.

programme.desc: Dr. Cyril Taft finds key evidence when he is assigned to surgical duty for a suspect.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Personal plans are interrupted when errors are found in what seemed to be a straight-forward, closed case; McGee and Delilah argue whether work should be discussed during dinner.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The virtual world has real consequences in Mike Hammer's latest case. Mike Hammer is offered a case by the worried grandmother of a missing young woman. Tamara had been working as a model for a racy website before her disappearance, and when Hammer's team discovers a snuff film posted online, he worries that she may have been victimized by something much more serious. Mike Hammer is on the case to either find Tamara, or bring her murderers to justice.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mayron Hughes may be one of the most sought after basketball players in the country, but the mysterious death of his former agents could threaten everything. The star athlete hires New York's most valuable private eye in order to prove his own innocence. The case becomes increasingly complicated, and the Hammer must look at an entire roster of suspects in order to find the real killer. From Mayron father to his new agent to Mayron himself, anyone could be the culprit.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Police tapes, video, and the testimony of a radar operator suggest something very strange was seen over Ohio in 1994; Holland, Michigan in 1994; and Millstadt, Illinois in 2000.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On April 21st, 2008, one of the most talked-about incidents in modern UFO history opened a new chapter--the Phoenix Lights.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: How would the military respond if UFOs suddenly invaded restricted U.S. airspace? It allegedly happened, and the team gets a rare interview with the Military Air Traffic Controller who was there.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: People driving home from an Ozzy Osbourne concert in Tingley Park, Ill., on Aug. 21, 2004, report seeing a large, triangular UFO with three bright red lights with more sightings happening on the following Halloween in suburban Chicago.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Late in the evening of April 16th, 2008, the tiny town of Kokomo, Indiana was rocked by an ear-piercing, high decibel boom. Houses shook. Thousands of panicked citizens called 911.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: New evidence suggests there was more than one UFO crash near Roswell. On July 8, 1947 at 5:26 EDT, an Associated Press news wire announced that soldiers from Roswell Army Air Field in New Mexico recovered a "flying disk" from a nearby rancher's property.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: What secrets lay buried in the never-before-seen files of a famous UFO investigator? In the early 1950s, James McDonald, a senior physicist at the University of Arizona, changed the entire course of UFO research.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: For five years Cindy Brown was married to Bobby Joe Long. During that time she was physically and emotionally battered by her husband who would go on to kill 10 women in Florida.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: When Tony Antonucci took up an apprenticeship with local contractor John Wayne Gacy, he had no idea that his new boss was an active serial killer.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: In December 2006 the bodies of five sex workers were discovered in Ipswich. It was a terrifying time for Jade Reynolds who worked in the red light district.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil
programme.desc: Jane Carson Sadler was brutally raped but survived at the hands of a man who murdered 13 people.

programme.desc: On June 12, 2016, Omar Mateen walked into Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida and massacred 49 people while wounding an additional 53, in the deadliest attack in American history.

programme.desc: Richard Beasley was a conman and serial killer who posed as a preacher and in 2011, posted advertisements on Craigslist to entice men to work with him on his farm.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.desc: Robert F. Kennedy's family members reflect on his legacy; the late senator's message of unifying a divided nation made him a hero to many people and his message still has resonance today, more than 50 years after his assassination.

programme.desc: The latest news, going beyond the headlines to see how lives are affected by the world around them.

programme.desc: When a mother is murdered in a home invasion the day before her best friend is shot outside the place they both worked, investigators suspect the crimes are linked.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A Jacksonville, Fla., firefighter discovers a disturbingly violent scene in his darkened bedroom on a Halloween weekend.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Investigators look for answers when a popular school superintendent is found dead in his western New York home.

programme.title: Sunday Today With Willie Geist

programme.title: Meet the Press
programme.desc: Interviews with public figures and those making news, setting the political agenda and spotlighting the impact Washington decision-making has on Americans.

programme.title: Notes of Protest: Afghanistan's Orchestra in Exile

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siberian Tiger is the biggest cat in the World. It takes down large prey with its 5 inch long canine teeth. And the American badgers sharp front claws make it one of the best burrowers. Plus toads undergo one of the most amazing transformations!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Our rivers and lakes are a major source of water and recreation. This week, we'll explore some of the World's most exciting waterways, from the midwest, to the upper east coast, on Xploration Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Honeybees are small and humble, but can engineer amazing things. Spiders can weave incredibly intricate webs. We look at the remarkable world of animal engineering, this week, on Xploration Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we'll examine the life cycle of a butterfly and delve into the mechanics of how a bird is able to take flight. Plus, the mystery of how a Venus Flytrap catches its prey is revealed.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we find out how the Jaguar's spots create a disruptive pattern that makes them harder for prey to see. We'll also learn how a bee sting really works, and how a salmon is able to migrate thousands of miles to spawn.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 3/17/09: David Wright clinches a finals berth for Team USA with a bases-clearing walk-off hit in the 9th inning.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Kurt Suzuki caps the Nationals' largest 9th-inning comeback victory with a walk-off home run

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 8/12/18 - David Bote lifts a pinch-hit walk-off grand slam to erase a three-run deficit with two outs in the bottom of the 9th inning against the Nationals.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: Brewers' ace CC Sabathia carries Milwaukee to their first playoff appearance in 26 years

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: In the 2019 Home Run Derby, Pete Alonso takes out fellow rookie Vladimir Guerrero Jr., becoming the second rookie ever to win the event.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Jim Leyland records his 700th win as manager in Detroit as the Tigers clinch the AL Central

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: In a historic victory, the Yankees secure their 27th World Series title, propelled by Hideki Matsui's legendary performance. His six runs driven in, a World Series record, almost single handedly beat the Phillies, propelling New York to a 7-3 win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Joe Musgrove throws the first no-hitter in Padres franchise history

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Luis Tiant silences the Reds in Game 1 of the 1975 World Series

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Down three runs with two outs in the ninth, the Red Sox fought back against the Yankees.

programme.title: MLB's Carded
programme.desc: Former All-Star Dmitri Young tells Greg Amsinger how he became an elite card collector while also playing in the big leagues on MLB's Carded.

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Oriole Park at Camden Yards, the baseball stadium built in 1992 that revolutionized modern ballpark design.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Jim Leyland steered the Marlins to their first ever franchise World Series win against Cleveland, a series that lasted seven games in 1997. Edgar Renteria hit the walk-off single in the 11th inning which plated Craig Counsell securing the conquest.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Brandon Woodruff homers and earns the win to lead the Brewers to a win in Game 1 of the 2018 NLCS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 3/14/17: Yadier Molina and Javier Bez back Team Puerto Rico's dominant pitching in their 3-1 win over Team Dominican Republic

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: World Series MVP Mariano Rivera leads the Yankees to the franchise's third championship in the last four seasons and 25th overall, sweeping the Braves in four games in a rematch of the 1996 Fall Classic.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ichiro Suzuki makes history in 2007 by hitting the first-ever inside-the-park home run during an All-Star Game. He was rewarded MVP for going 3-for-3 at the plate and collecting two RBIs in an American League victory, 5-4.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Fernando Valenzuela throws a complete game and Ron Cey hits a homer to help the Dodgers win Game 3.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: In 2015, Wilmer Flores' walk-off homer amid trade rumors for the Mets showcased resilience and loyalty, endearing him to fans and etching his place in team history.

programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1970 Dodge Challenger to a swap meet for speed parts.

programme.desc: Highlighting the Roadkill Boost Caboose, a trailer with an engine that powers a centrifugal supercharger that sends boost to the tow vehicle.

programme.desc: The mayhem is back complete with its new 707hp drivetrain from a 2015 Dodge Charger Hellcat; the off-road Hornet; the Disgustang; the Crusher Impala; time for big action.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan built (or unbuilt) the Vette Kart: an '85 Chevy Corvette stripped to nothing but a chassis and powertrain; now, it's back and the guys try to execute the least-predictable stunt ever.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the mid-engined, GMC Crew Cab, road-going dragster 500 miles to the Roadkill Zip-Tie Drags at Tucson Dragway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Last time the guys tried to rescue this 1977 Chevy El Camino, the result was a transmission fluid spill that can still be seen from space; now it's back as the guys attempt a road trip to the Merrill Ice Drags on a frozen river in Wisconsin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Building 440-powered Suzuki Samurai entirely out of a junkyard in Arizona.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Old fashioned, fun road trip in random, unreliable junk; David and Mike buy a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup, sight unseen, and hit the road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike play around in hot-rodded pickups with a few friends.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid; he recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition; Finnegan works with buddies Tony Angelo, David Newbern and Daniel Boshears to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Taking a 50-year-old car from a junkyard and motoring it to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David, Mike and Steve throw cars off a cliff at Glacier View in Alaska.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Draguar makes an epic return all the way to racing at NHRA Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back with an upgraded suspension and it's ready to dominate the autocross; David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich enter Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Neb., a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other; David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend hosts for an all-out war on tires.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike salvage a Road Runner that had an encounter with a pole.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike work on improving their Mazdarati mini-truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip a big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada to Du Quoin, Illinois.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys road trip two beaters to a deserted factory for a winter battle.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys' attempt at a Hemi Gremmie road trip is foiled by engine trouble.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan buy an '86 Trans Am and take it for its first road test on the drag-and-drive event Sick Week; with a swapped 350 V8 and a six-speed, the big question is whether they be able to make it faster each day or even finish the race.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger attempt to get a bucket-list '66 Corvette -- abandoned halfway through an LS swap and restoration -- back on the road. With multiple iterations and attempts, the 'Vette hasn't been on the road for 30 years. Will they change that?

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern light the tires as they road test their LS-powered '66 C2 Corvette from Oakland to Las Vegas with the smokiest burnouts ever. Follow along as they blaze the coast and hit the drag strip with Dulcich before breaking down in Sin City.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan meet up with Derek Bieri to take a 1968 big-block Dart on a tire-smoking road trip, which includes a final run down Memphis International Raceway and some high-speed passes down George Ray's Wildcat Dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern revive the '73 Chevy Ramp Truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan surprises Freiburger by fixing up the Gremmie for Roadkill Nights.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A road trip keeps Freiburger distracted prior to the Hemi Gremmie surprise.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the Hemi Gremmie from Detroit to St. Louis.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys fix and tune their way to Arizona to rescue a '75 Dodge Dart.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The Crusher Impala gets a new 9-inch rear and a suspension overhaul.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: After a tune up, the '69 Crusher Impala hits the road and the dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and Wiley Stevens prep two cars for a farm rally course.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freibuger and Dulcich can't pass up buying a '41 Ford former race car.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong join Dulcich to revive the Wreck Runner.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys take a '68 Dart home for an engine bay makeover and tune-up.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys revive Roadkill's '66 Dodge D100 to dig out a buried '60 Ranchero.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Clearwater, Florida is in competition with Miami for showcasing electrifying matchups and bare-knuckle talent. A unique venue hosts Richman vs Lozano in the main event, Fortt vs. Brito in the co-main and Ridge vs. Randall.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Angel Hernandez vs. Rayne Wells, Jessica Borga vs. Katharina Lehner, Jay Jackson vs. Idrees Wasi and Abdiel Velazquez vs. Travis Thompson help kick off a nine-fight Fight Night in Clearwater, Florida.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Some of the most dominant performances from KnuckleMania IV. Mike Perry headlines against Thiago Alves, Lorenzo Hunt looks to make history against heavyweight champ Mick Terrill, Jeremiah Riggs welcomes Alfredo Angulo to the Squared Circle.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Before the halfway point of the evening, Los Angeles had already put on a phenomenal show. Complete with upsets, dominance and five-round bangers.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In a historic and first ever trip to Connecticut's Mohegan Sun Casino, Natalie Gage vs. Sarah Click, Rick Hawn vs. Stephen Stengel, Mike Trizano vs. Louie Lopez and Jimmie Rivera vs. Daniel Straus make an outstanding account for BKFC talent.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: A stacked fight card in Omaha features some heavy hitters in intriguing matchups! Watch BRAUN vs MCINTOSH, GROSU vs MARTINEZ,COCHRANE vs HOLLOWAY &TRINIDAD-SNAKE vs PAGUE as they battle during a Fight Night.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In three epic clashes, JOSH KREJCI welcomes NATE MORROW to the Squared Circle,TOMMY STRYDOM takes on COREY ROBERTS and BOBBY TAYLOR goes to war with RYAN ROBERTS. Don't miss these incredible showings of toughness from Omaha!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Prospects throw down in a handful of first-time showings in Denver with RAMIRO FIGUEROA vs BRETT HUDSON and JOSH HUBER vs ANDREW YATES. Also, in BKFC veteran matchups, CRISTINA CRIST, CASSIE ROBB, SAWYER DEPEE and KEEGAN VANDERMEER match up.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch some serious showings of toughness and skill asJOSEPH CREER vs DANIEL MITCHELL,ZEB VINCENT vs CASEY MOSES,DERRICK FINDLEY vs SERGIO LOPEZ &DYLAN SCHULTE vs ROBERTO ARMAS lay it all on the line in Denver.

programme.title: Maros Antonio Barrera vs Erik Morales III
programme.desc: On November 27th, 2004 Maros Antonio Barrera and Erik Morales fought for the final time in an iconic battle resulting in a win for Barrera.

programme.title: Best of Floyd Mayweather
programme.desc: The best fights and moments of undefeated five-weight-division world champion: Floyd Mayweather

programme.title: Roy Jones Jr vs Percy Harris
programme.desc: On December 5th, 1992 Roy Jones Jr. defeated Percy Harris for the vacant WBC Continental Americas Super Middleweight belt.

programme.title: Roy Jones Jr vs Glenn Wolfe
programme.desc: On February 13th 1993 Roy Jones Jr. defeated Glenn Wolfe by technical knockout in round 1.

programme.title: Roy Jones Jr. vs Julio Ceasar Gonzalez
programme.desc: On July 28th, 2001 Roy Jones Jr. faced Julio Ceasar Gonzalez in a light heavyweight title fight.

programme.title: Timothy Bradley vs Manny Pacquiao I
programme.desc: On June 9th, 2012 Timothy Bradley defeated Manny Pacquiao in their first meeting causing controversy in the boxing world.

programme.title: Manny Pacquiao vs Timothy Bradley II
programme.desc: On April 12th, 2012 Manny Pacquiao defeated Timothy Bradley in their second meeting by unanimous decision.

programme.title: Manny Pacquiao vs Timothy Bradley III
programme.desc: On April 9th 2016, Manny Pacquaio deafeated Timothy Bradley for the final time gaining the vacant WBO welterweight belt.

programme.title: Marvin Hagler vs Thomas Hearns
programme.desc: On April 15th, 1985, Marvin Hagler fought Thomas Hearns for the undisputed Middleweight Title.

programme.title: Shane Mosley vs Oscar De La Hoya
programme.desc: On June 17th, 2000, Shane Mosley fought Oscar De La Hoya for the WBC and IBA Welterweight Titles.

programme.title: Shane Mosley vs Oscar De La Hoya 2
programme.desc: On September 13th, 2003, Shane Mosley rematched Oscar De La Hoya for the World Super Welterweight Championship

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs Luis Ramon Campas
programme.desc: On May 3rd, 2003, Oscar De La Hoya fought Luis Ramon Campas for the WBC and WBA Super Welterweight Title.

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs John John Molina
programme.desc: On February 18th, 1995 Oscar De la Hoya and John John Molina fought for WBO World Lightweight Title.

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs Jeff Mayweather
programme.desc: On March 13th, 1993, Oscar De La Hoya fought Jeff Mayweather in a lightweight bout.

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs Rafael Ruelas
programme.desc: On May 6th, 1995, Oscar De La Hoya fought Rafael Ruelas for the IBF and WBO World Lightweight Title.

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs Giorgio Campanella
programme.desc: On May 27th, 1994, Oscar De La Hoya fought Giorgio Campanella for the WBO World Super Featherweight Title.

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs Curtis Strong
programme.desc: On February 6th, 1993, Oscar De La Hoya fought Curtis Strong in a super lightweight bout.

programme.title: Genaro Hernandez vs Azumah Nelson
programme.desc: On March 22nd, 1997, Genaro Hernandez fought Azumah Nelson for the World Super Featherweight Championship.

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs Pernell Whitaker
programme.desc: On April 12th, 1997, Oscar De La Hoya fought Pernell Whitaker for the WBC Welterweight Title.

programme.title: Oscar De La Hoya vs Fernando Vargas

Life challenges and misunderstandings complicate their budding romance, but true love prevails.

programme.title: The Perfect Mother
programme.desc: Linda, a determined mother, faces the daily struggles of raising her son amidst the unpredictable presence of her husband. When a series of hardships push her to the edge, Linda's plea for assistance leads to Ahmad being taken into CPS custody.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.desc: Len Richards and his brother, Ab, confront a Lucas McCain look-alike, Earl Bantry and his sidekick K.C. Peters, for slaughtering one of Richards' steers.

programme.desc: Lucas and Mark stop on the way to the county fair to deliver a message to Micah, who is escorting a prisoner to be hanged. Mark and Lucas recognize the prisoner.

programme.desc: Mark and Milly are shocked when Lucas begins gambling. They don't know that Lucas is "undercover" trying to catch a man cheating.

programme.desc: Mark befriends singer-banjoist Lafayette Bly, a blind man with an acute sense of hearing and a very strong grip.

programme.desc: A retired lawman's irrational jealousy threatens not only to destroy his marriage but also to make him an easy target for someone who wants him dead.

programme.desc: No one is more surprised than Micah when newcomer Leota Carraway claims he's her long-lost husband and the father of her child.

programme.desc: Pat gets himself a mail-order sweetheart who is more than he can handle.

programme.desc: A headstrong woman sheriff is intent upon arresting Gene, unaware that he is a lawman.

programme.desc: Gene and Pat are called in by a young sheriff to help stop a series of mine shipment robberies by an unknown gang. The trail leads to a witch-like recluse's cabin.

programme.desc: A clever safe cracker uses Pat's mail-order telescope to get the information he needs to commit his crimes.

programme.desc: Gene finds himself battling some very lifelike ghosts when he gets involved with an archaeologist and a clever outlaw.

programme.desc: Gene becomes involved in the capture of criminals who threaten the life of a conniving prospector.

programme.title: Steel Gaze: An Unauthorized Story on Clint Eastwood
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Chino
programme.desc: When an ostracized mixed-race horse breeder takes on a runaway teen and teaches him his craft, an unlikely friendship grows out of their hardships.

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Two gunmen track an escaped murderer to a lawless Western town, where they cross paths with a beautiful widow with a dangerous agenda.

programme.title: The Train Robbers
programme.desc: After the death of her husband, Mrs. Lowe (Ann-Margret) posts a $50,000 reward in return for help recovering her train-robber beau's hidden fortune, under the pretense of returning it. Lane (John Wayne) assembles a group of cowboys to head to Mexico with Mrs. Lowe, enticed by the reward money. As they cross into Mexico, however, they realize they're being followed, by both a posse of bandits and a single mysterious rider (Ricardo Montalban) with his own agenda.

programme.title: 3 Godfathers
programme.desc: Thieves and rustlers Robert Hightower (John Wayne), Pete Fuerte (Pedro Armendriz) and the Abilene Kid (Harry Carey Jr.) rob a bank in a small Arizona town. Pursued across the desert by the indefatigable Sheriff Buck Sweet (Ward Bond), the trio lose their horses, suffer injuries, and come across a stranded woman (Mildred Natwick) who is dying while giving birth. Promising to carry the woman's newborn to safety, the repentant criminals struggle to reach the village of New Jerusalem.

programme.title: Cheyenne Autumn
programme.desc: Large-scale frontier epic telling the true story of a band of Cheyenne Indians who, starved nearly to extinction on an inhospitable reservation, embark on the long trek back to their distant ancestral homelands in Wyoming, despite opposition from the US Army. Their journey revives old hatreds - and the threat of war.

programme.title: Last Stand at Saber River
programme.desc: From an Elmore Leonard book.

programme.title: Stampede
programme.desc: As a dispute erupts over water access, a rancher falls for a charming settler while crooked businessmen try to play both sides of the conflict.

programme.title: A Big Hand for the Little Lady
programme.desc: When a yearly high-stakes poker game begins between the five richest men in Laredo, Texas, all other activity in the Wild West town comes to a stop as everyone gathers to watch the action. Recovering gambler Meredith (Henry Fonda), passing through town on the way to San Antonio, gets roped into the game by lawyer Otto Habershaw (Kevin McCarthy). When the stress of the game becomes too much to bear, his disapproving wife, Mary (Joanne Woodward), must step in to save the family fortune.

programme.title: The Plunderers
programme.desc: Four toughs intent on ransacking a town find their plans thwarted by a one-armed Civil War hero and his brutish pal.

programme.title: The Last Outlaw
programme.desc: A former bandit finds the frontier a very different place when he emerges from prison after serving 25 years.

programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.desc: An unexpected road trip during a blizzard with a stranger to make her wedding forces a small-town teacher to take a hard look at her life choices.

programme.title: Christmas Casanova
programme.desc: Podcaster Elise partners with Daniyal to create an unforgettable Christmas, but it seems he's wooing the wrong woman amidst the festive chaos.

programme.title: Christmas Coupon
programme.desc: An ice skating instructor reunites with her high school sweetheart, now a professional hockey player, when he signs his niece up for skating lessons.

programme.title: Grumpy Old Santa
programme.desc: Nics life plan derails when his wife leaves. Five years later, a secret romance brings unexpected joy and uproarious complications.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition starts in Barmouth, north Wales, at the Bae Abermaw Hotel, run by newly engaged couple Rosie Lewis and Dexter Green. On arrival, guest Tracy finds herself in a hairy situation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Rigsby's Guest House in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, run by Tracy Ward. The lack of en-suite bathrooms causes a stink, and some guests cannot figure out the pricing.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Somerset Arms in Semington, Wiltshire, where John Adams is joined by friend Dennis Gowie. But cleanliness issues and thin walls gave cause for concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Cross Keys Hotel, Saffron Walden, Essex run by former flight attendant Nici Van Valen. The guests love the luxury but a mark on Tracy's towel leaves a stain on her stay and tensions are at boiling point.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: First up, Jon and Lisa welcome their rivals to the Swan Motel in Norfolk, but some of their guests find a surprise in their drawers. Later, Jon shows off his magical hosting skills on a boat tour.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michael and Scott welcome their rivals to the Hare and Hounds in Essex. They take their guests clay pigeon shooting, but Jon and Lisa find it hard to forget the feedback that their hosts gave them the day before.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sir Ben Slade welcomes his rivals to the 13th-century Maunsel House in Somerset, but the extra charge for a hot breakfast leaves some guests with a bad taste in their mouths. Meanwhile, Jon and Lisa turn detective to uncover Ben's past.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gary and Linda Kellaway welcome their rivals to Lower Keats Glamping in Devon. At dinner, Jon turns joker, but Michael and Scott have a big revelation, which is no laughing matter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four more sets of bed and breakfast owners compete, kicking off in Tyne and Wear at Tynemouth 61, owned by hospitality veteran Stephen Minns, who grew up believing he was born with blue blood.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Black Horse Inn in North Yorkshire, where unlikely double act manager Steve Barker and side-kick and bar manager Callum Dixon believe they can win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to The Shores Hotel in Blackpool, where bed and breakfast beginner Enid Hall prides herself in offering clean rooms at bargain prices. However, the guests are not as impressed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Hilltop Hideaways in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, where cousins in law Lottie and Lil Ellis are on a mission to put the glamorous in glamping.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Runswick Bay, Yorkshire and The Cliffemount Hotel, with general manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty. They hope the views be enough to wow the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Next up is the Quayside Hotel in Boston, Lincolnshire, run by Alistair and partner Lana, where most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels stuck in a neon nightmare.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, run by couple Claire and Adam. Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers, but the other guests are shocked by their surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Swan House in Kelvedon, Essex, where owner Daniele is joined by sister Chantal. On arrival, the traditional dcor impresses, but Lana is left with wardrobe woes.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire run by colleagues Genice Hall and Cathy Hudson. There's a battle of the breakfasts, and feedback that cuts deep.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Railway Inn near Hull, run by couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize. The guests find little to complain about, but the pressure is on for Luke's breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Driftwood bed and breakfast in Weymouth, run by Sarah and Pete Healey. On arrival Cathy and Genice find the place completely ship shape and Lygia spies the host's disco balls.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman and breakfast chef Mary Murray pride themselves on a luxury stay, but emotions run high.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Nottinghamshire at The Clumber Park Hotel, where general Manager Rajesh Saraf and his colleague Yuanee Tampoe believe all guests should be treated as gods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Family Tree in Derbyshire, where owners Charlie and Sam Cameron want their guests to feel like one of the family. However, some of them are creeped out by the rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to The Royal Hotel in Sheerness, Kent, where partners Sarah Lewry and Gareth Segrove believe they offer great value for money, but the guests have a lot to say.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final visit is to Adhurst Yurts in Hampshire, where owner Alison Lubbock is on a mission to educate her guests to think green, but they question the provenance of her produce.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Sancton, Yorkshire and The North Star Club, owned by Carolyn Van Outersterp and daughter Galatea who hope their peaceful woodland cabins will win over the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Friends Bed and Breakfast in Blackpool, Lancashire run by Luke and John Conway, who are the self-proclaimed unique selling point. But feedback from some leaves a bitter taste.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to The Lincoln Holiday Retreat, which owner Debbie Grant has built from the ground up over the past twenty years. However, some of the guests think the dcor is too dated.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Chapel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, owned by Mark Hinchcliffe and Heidi Donohoe, who pride themselves on offering something special in their converted chapel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Heather and Sally hope their fussy cleaning regime will impress their rivals at Brockley Hall Hotel in Yorkshire. But there are problems in some rooms, and the breakfast puzzles the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alistair, who has fitted out luxury hotels including The Savoy, welcomes his rivals to his refurbished village pub, The Star Inn 1744, where his breakfast ordering system raises questions.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michelle and Jason welcome their rivals to their luxury lodges at Croft Farm Park in Gloucestershire. The guests go canoeing but some struggle to stay afloat when someone sticks his oar in.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Tracy welcome their rivals to their bed and breakfast Harbour Vista in Poole, and most of their guests are surprised that it's not more lavish, when they realise they are staying in Steve's house.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Grosmont, North Yorkshire, at Grosmont House B&B, mother and daughter Selma and Roxy hope their personal touch and attention to detail will win over their competitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Monkspool bed and breakdast in Twyning, Gloucestershire. The establishment is owned by husband and wife Paulo and Suzi Lacey, who pride themselves on their top-quality mattresses.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to Pymgate Lodge Hotel in Cheadle, where Romanian husband and wife Michael and Leda Ardeleanu believe their hosting skills will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to pub, restaurant and bed and breakfast The Stag and Huntsman in Hambleden, Oxfordshire, managed by South African chef Marius Pretorius and his partner Sarah Harris.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Weymouth, Dorset at The Somerset House Hotel, run by couple Adam and Holly, who hope their boutique rooms and BBQ breakfast will whet their guests' appetite.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Dawlish in Devon, where owner of The Knitting Hotel Belinda Harris-Reid and colleague Brenda Watson are hoping their guests get excited about all things woolly.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Stade Court Hotel in Hythe in Kent, where the owners, Sandeep and Vaishalee Chawla, have a hosting policy of treating their guests like a god.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mandy McCready and her assistant Sam Gould welcome their rivals to the Goodlife Guest House, a family business in Harwich in Essex.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ronnie and Steph Caird welcome their rivals to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen. where it is all about keeping it in the family. But one guest's culinary background piles on the pressure for Ronnie at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Shauna and Fiona welcome their rivals to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire. But Steve and Allard think the dcor is dated, and a breakfast waiting game causes a storm in a teacup.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Allard welcome their rivals to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District. Fiona and Shauna think it's picture perfect, but other guests face tricky technology and cleanliness concerns.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Strontian Boutique in Strontian, Scotland, where Callum Pegg and his partner head chef Darren Anderson want to treat their guests to an exclusive stay.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Helix Hotel in Grangemouth, Stirlingshire, where host Nawaz Haq wants to show off his hotel, catering to the travelling businessman. Come morning, the group raises concerns over the breakfast banquet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Black Boy Hotel in Sudbury, where hosts Kate Martin and sister Marie Carlton want their guests to kick back and embrace the historical surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to The Lodge Bed and Breakfast in Cannock, Staffordshire, where hosts Lee and Marie Garnett are hoping their guests take to their homely BandB, but have they done enough to win?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent run by 21-year-old partners James Tindall and Jessica Walton, who believe age is but a number. Over breakfast, a frank airing of views sets the standard for the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, run by mother and daughter duo Amanda and Becci. On arrival, everyone is wowed by the stylish shepherd huts with outside bath.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions are simmering as the guests head to The White House in Brighton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.desc: Day two of the competition is at Grassington Lodge in Yorkshire, where owner Diane Lowe reckons `Diane's little touches' have helped make her rooms a cut above.

programme.desc: Jeanette and Andrew Collette are the third hosts to open their doors in this particular competition. They welcome their fellow B and Bers to their homestay - Manor Farm in Oxfordshire.

programme.desc: The third visit is to pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal in Kent where owner Michael Prime is joined by his doting mum Lorna.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This visit is to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire, where entrepreneur Mark Genders hopes his guests will think his small rooms are perfectly formed. However, he admits his `very' honest appraisal of his rivals' offerings may work against him.

programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ravensden, Bedfordshire, where owners Graham and Julia Ashley run Outfields Farm B&B. The hosts treat their guests to an adrenaline-fuelled afternoon at an indoor sky diving centre.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: At Compton House, in Newark, Nottinghamshire, Lisa Holloway prides herself on providing a home from home for her guests. Sadly, Sam and Ian Sugden are disappointed by the dust, while Dave and wife Jo, find the price for a night hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate hope their guests at The White Horse pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, will embrace the pub vibe, but sadly Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked in their room by mistake.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Trafford in Blackpool owned by couple Robbie and John who are proud of their traditional bucket and spade B&B. On arrival the guests are pleasantly surprised, even if previous host Phil is hell-bent on finding some dust.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Rising Sun Inn in Bath, where owners Lorraine Hawkins and Norman Butcher hope to bring their guests up to standard by having a dress code.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Peacock, monster, unicorn, deer and lion take the stage for their second performances; Joel McHale joins as a guest panelist.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Rabbit, alien, raven, poodle and bee each take the stage to perform a second time; Joel McHale joins as a guest panelist.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The ultimate guessing game kicks off with the first six undercover celebrity singers PEACOCK, HIPPO, MONSTER, UNICORN, DEER and LION facing off against one another in elaborate head-to-toe costumes. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke as they attempt to guess WHO is the performer behind the mask. Between all twelve of the celebrity competitors on the show, theyve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. One singer will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity. Hear them sing, get the clues and guess the celebrity.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~65,000 debt.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's fourth programme is La Riviera, a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~8000 a week to run, the place boasts top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff with Michelin star-studded backgrounds. Loic is on a mission, to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of haggis, tatties and deep-fried Mars bars. But though he's hungry for success, he's French, he's arrogant and the food's pretentious.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E12 - Episode 12

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E01 - Episode 1

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre d Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~150,000 of their own money into their trendy caf bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E03 - Chinese

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E04 - British

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E02 - Episode 2

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E03 - Episode 3

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's program is Clubway 41, despite being voted Blackpool Tourist Board Restaurant of the year, the place is dire straits. It is the prime example of HOW NOT TO RUN A RESTAURANT. Owner DAVE is the flakey self-appointed head chef, who hasn't been in a kitchen for 30 years and can't cook. His partner DAWN invents bizarre dishes for the menu, ranging from "tomato and cointreau soup" to "pork with brie, nectarine and whiskey sauce". Gordon faces a hellish week, Clubway 41 is breaking every rule in book, can he bring Dave, Dawn and their food back to earth?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E05 - Thai

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E06 - French

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's program Gordon Ramsay travels to the seaside to help ailing hotel and restaurant, The Sandgate. This is Lois and Peter's first venture into the catering industry - the happily married couple used to enjoy eating in restaurants, so thought it might be fun to own one. 18months later their dream has turned into a nightmare and they're loosing ~4,000 a month.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: This week Gordon is at a god-awful Italian restaurant in Derby. La Gondola is stuck in a time-warp with naff Seventies cuisine, bad net curtains and no customers. New owner Daniela bought the place because she got married there back in the day but her sentimentality has blinded her to the fact that she's bagged a white elephant. Gordon's biggest problem is head chef Steve, one of the worst he's ever met, and one who'd rather open a tin of tuna or a packet of soup than create a proper meal. Can Gordon get the kitchen cooking again and save La Gondala from sinking?

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Sixteen of the countrys finest junior home cooks compete for eight of the Top 20 spots on this seasons MASTERCHEF. After being split into four groups, each with a distinct signature dish, the kids get started. Only two contestants from each group will find out if they will succeed in moving on to the next round of challenges.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining junior chefs compete for the final 12 spots in the Top 20. Making dishes ranging from cupcakes, to steak and lobster, the young chefs are tested to their limits and will find out if they will move on to the next round.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: While visiting the Eagle Rock area of Los Angeles, Chef Ramsay stops by Capri. This Italian restaurant is filthy, serves terrible food and is in disarray all thanks to a lazy set of twins.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Down in the Big Easy, Chef Ramsay tries to inject some life into a Southern eatery beset with atrocious d_cor and menus.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay orders the three remaining contestants to serve an entire dining room. Who will create the best dish, and who will be sent home without their just desserts?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: In the season finale, the final two with some help from the eliminated chefs compete in a simulation that tests their abilities to run a restaurant.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants try to impress the judges and advance to the next round.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
