programme.title: Incredible Animals
programme.desc: In this episode we'll see the amazing strength of the leaf cutter ant. Find out how fast can a pronghorn really run, and how the desert camel is able to survive in such extreme conditions.

programme.title: Journey to Africa
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffes neck, and feel the power of a hyena jaws.

programme.title: Water
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits an estuary in North Carolina and catches blue crabs, which have adapted to both saltwater and freshwater. Then Philippe goes to Curacao and takes a submersible 500 feet below the surface to look at sea life. We'll also look at the latest NASA satellite that enables us to monitor precipitation around the world. Then we visit a hotel near Quebec City that's made entirely of ice.

programme.title: Earth in Motion
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the various ways our planet is always in motion. We'll visit the volcanic Mt. Saint Helens in Washington, where the movement of the earth's crust caused this mountain to erupt and create devastation in 1980. We'll also discover how mountains are formed and earthquakes are caused. Then we'll look at how our oceans and waterways are in constant motion. And then we'll see how our planet itself is speeding through the galaxy at unimaginable speeds.

programme.title: In Flight
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffes neck, and feel the power of a hyena jaws.

programme.title: Predator and Prey
programme.desc: In this episode, we find out how the Jaguar's spots create a disruptive pattern that makes them harder for prey to see. We'll also learn how a bee sting really works, and how a salmon is able to migrate thousands of miles to spawn.

programme.title: Santa Fe, New Mexico
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham tours Santa Fe, New Mexico and shows us how to capture the best photos of the city's beautiful landmarks with your phone.

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Los Angeles

programme.title: Station Nightclub Fire
programme.desc: A survivor reflects on The Station nightclub fire on February 20, 2003 in West Warwick, Rhode Island. One hundred people died and more than 200 were injured. The fire was sparked by pyrotechnics that went off during metal band, Great White's performance. The episode looks at who did and didn't take responsibility for the fire and fire code safety measures that have changed since.

programme.title: Surfside Collapse
programme.desc: On June 24, 2021, the Champlain Towers South, a beachfront condominium in the Miami suburb of Surfside, Florida partially collapsed, killing 98 people. Family members of victims and a WPTV anchor reflect on the tragedy. The episode looks at changes in building codes and laws and research on saltwater corrosion.

programme.title: Independent America
programme.desc: Independent voters discuss a range of issues, including inflation, immigration, and abortion. In this special 1-hour documentary, correspondent Gianna Toboni spends time with voters in their daily lives to see how the major issues are impacting them on a personal level.

programme.title: Targeted Teacher
programme.desc: The murder of a respected college professor sends shockwaves through suburban Richmond, Virginia. Cops investigate the homicide nonstop until evidence reveals a cold-blooded killer's premeditated plot.

programme.title: Lone Star Killer
programme.desc: A church-going mother with no known enemies suddenly disappears from Northeastern Texas. As cops investigate the missing persons case they uncover a serial predator from the shadows and rush to stop him before he kills again.

programme.title: Missing In Minnesota
programme.desc: The clock is ticking as police in northern Minnesota rush to rescue a kidnapped college student. It takes NASA technology for law enforcement to uncover the identity of the abductor, who turns out to be a serial predator.

programme.title: A Killer Hand
programme.desc: The slaying of a casino worker in Las Vegas, Nevada sends panic through Sin City. When cops investigate beyond the bright lights of the strip, they uncover a murder conspiracy that is months in the making.

programme.title: The Craigslist Killer
programme.desc: When three different women who advertised in the Erotic Services section of Craigslist are assaulted, and one of them killed, Boston police match surveillance video and witness reports to a young man that no one would ever suspect to be a killer.

programme.title: Snipers In The Capital
programme.desc: When a deadly sniper terrorizes the DC area for weeks, frantic police put out an APB for a white van. But the FBI has a theory that there might be more than one sniper, and they're not driving a white van.

programme.title: Intern Gone Missing
programme.desc: When government intern Chandra Levy goes missing just hours after she decides to move to a new city, detectives discover she may have been having an affair with a senator the only suspect with a possible motive. A man already in jail claims to know more, but can he be trusted?

programme.title: Operation Insurance Scam Artist: Arson For Hire
programme.desc: Free-lance undercover detective Bob Cerrone is hired by a Denver insurance company to investigate a series of insurance claims. During his investigation, Cerrone is solicited by the insured to rob his office, sink a boat, and lastly, to burn down a row house he owns. When Cerrone protests that there are people living in the apartments, he is told, "I don't care." The detective gets it all on tape and the man is arrested for solicitation of arson.

programme.title: Operation Con Cino: Rocky Mountain High
programme.desc: Denver cop Joe Padilla infiltrates a thriving drug crew in the center of the Rocky Mountains. Padilla is nearly shot during one exchange but continues to do deals as he goes up the drug dealing food chain. Padilla steals a car load of cocaine and corners the traffickers in an outrageous heist and takedown that for a time, halts the flow of drugs in Denver.

programme.title: Operation Missouri 500: Dogfighting Duo
programme.desc: Jeff Heath of the Missouri Highway Patrol takes on the alias of a dog fighting breeder to infiltrate the horrific and violent world of illegal dog fighting. Problem is, Heath and his partner must partake in the torture of the animals they enter in fights to convince dog fighting promoters and owner they are genuine. He captures many events on hidden camera right up to the takedown, which arrests numerous dog fighters in several states.

programme.title: The Age Of Astrology
programme.desc: How did astrology become a multi-billion-dollar business? Correspondent Gelareh Darabi shows viewers the new technology and ancient practices driving a golden age for astrology, from a packed convention in Los Angeles to an ashram in southern India.

programme.title: Solving The Flood
programme.desc: A new generation of American infrastructure aims to fight flooding and climate threats in innovative ways. "In Real Life" revisits The Big U in New York to see how this and other ambitious projects have been able to stem the tide against rising sea levels and severe storms.

programme.title: Scripps News Showcase: Banksy And The Rise Of Outlaw Art
programme.desc: Mysterious street artist Banksy uses his craft to create political and social statements.

programme.title: An Ex Attacks
programme.desc: When a young man is brutally murdered in his home, the only suspect with a motive is his ex-girlfriend, who claims she hasn't seen the victim for months. programme.title: Operation Searchlight: White Supremacist Heist
programme.desc: Mike McCommas acts as point man to the FBI's case against the Arizona Patriots, a white supremacist group. McCommas discovers that the gang is plotting an armored car heist and planning to kill the drivers before escaping into the desert. The group may have pulled it off were it not for McCommas living with them for eight months, and preventing the heist and murders the day before they go down.
